Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tedmonson
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - we stayed in only 1 bedroom unit March 22-29, 2012 - loved it! Great room, plenty of space for the 4 of us (2 kids). This is a great location for getting around San Diego - right in the Gaslamp area. It is definitely loud at night - especially on the weekends - but it can be entertaining to watch some of the people down there! At times it did seem like non-stop action from police, ambulances, and fire trucks going by in every-which-direction, but it was still a comfortable place to stay. The staff here were absolutely I N C R E D I B L E - always friendly, willing to help, and great service all around! With the bell-men at the door it made it feel safe to come and go from the resort any time of day. There is a trolley stop only a block away - made for a convenient way to get around without a car. Parking is via vallet parking with unlimited in/out for $29/day for 2012 - seems pricey, but compared to area parking it is quite reasonable - we did 5 of our days with no vehicle then rented a car to get to some further out places the last 2 days. The mass transit via buses/trolley's is superb in the area with frequent service - easy to get to San Diego Zoo, Sea World, USS Midway museum, Coronado island, and many other places. If you are going - check into the Go-San Diego Card - good way to access many popular destinations with one single (pricey, but worth it) payment. Would absolutely stay here again! Room for improvement? - needs a swimming pool and hot tub. Other than that - GREAT! Thanks Wyndham!

Reviews.Title: “Home base for traveling”
Reviews.Author: mesash
Reviews.Content: Harbour Lights is a Wyndham property at the north end of the Gaslamp district a block away from Horton Plaza. We had a large room that fit a king bed, and a queen sofa bed, eating table and full kitchen totally supplied, and bath that could be handicap size. The location is perfect for walking to restaurants in the Gaslamp district. Valet parking with unlimited in & out available. Our room on the back side was fairly quiet of street noise. The walls are thin so you can hear toilets flushing and people in the hall. It looks renovated so the halls and rooms are clean and comfortable. There is a gym, steam room, sauna, snack center with vending machines, and laundry facilities. This is a timeshare vacation resort by Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Location is for Night Life”
Reviews.Author: katNM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wyndam Harbour Lights in December 2011. Overall, the hotel is clean and the staff was very helpful. The rooms are large in size and the decor was pleasant. However, at night the area is very loud. You can hear the party crowd well into the early mornings on the weekends. This hotel is located right in downtown San Diego - so in the mornings you will find homeless people sleeping on the streets and the smell from the night before can be over whelming. If you’re looking for a quiet location this isn't it, but if you’re interested in night life the Harbour Lights is in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: cutemel6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Harbour Lights this weekend. We had a fabulous stay! The friendly staff was very helpful from the moment we arrived. Loved the room, already booked our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a nice view”
Reviews.Author: Connie K
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfortable, clean, helpful front desk. Parking is the pits, not conviently located for Convention as indicated. Maybe I'll try it on a relaxing trip and enjoy it more.

Reviews.Title: “an excellant holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangolfer16
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights at the Wyndham Harbour Lights ....... and I can honestly say is was a great holiday. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and very professional! ..a reflection of the management!!! We went to an 'update' session and it was pleasant, timely and the salesperson answered some questions for us (did not buy and no pressure to buy!). We had lots of wonderful suggestions from the staff and it helped since we needed the public transit ........ very easy to use!! The location is great for meals out, seeing different sites, and shopping (grocery store close by). Loved the Old Town, the Zoo, the USS Midway tour, over to Coronada (ferry) and had a wonderful meal at the 'Fish Market and Restaurant" (right beside the USS Midway)...watched the sun set over the bay! Would love to return! Rented a car for the day and headed up the coast...La Jolla and lunch at Torre Pines Golf course.......great view! Lots of homeless in the area so be prepared to see them but they were no problem!!! We would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “A1 service”
Reviews.Author: Nsj89
Reviews.Content: This is an average property on a busy street in the Gaslamp District of San Diego. The thing that set this place apart is the tremendous staff. They are the best. Their attentive to needs and very fun. They were almost friends after a weeks stay! They r a great reason to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mel4osu
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel and the service is top of the class. We felt like we were "someone" every time we approached the hotel with a cheerful greeting and the doors being opened for us. When we checked in the staff had our bags waiting in our room. The staff was very helpful with giving suggestions of where to eat and the must sees in San Diego. The valet service is pricey but SO SO SO worth it! $29 a day goes a long way! We had originally thought that we would try to park in a lot thinking we would save money until we read the lot rules and they wanted to charge for every time we went in and out not to mention the not so close walk to go get your car. With Harbour Lights Valet we picked up the phone and said we needed our rental car and walked down stairs and within minutes it was there - when we brought rental car back same thing pulled up gave them the keys and walked right into our hotel. So worth the $29 a day. We stayed here 10/27/11-11/1/11. If I was to return I certainly would not stay here the same weekend as their Halloween Monster Bash - total craziness and we made the mistake of going out to eat out of the city and when we came back it took us an hour just to go a couple of streets over to our hotel because of the event traffic. However with that being said boy I have never seen a city go all out for Halloween like San Diego - go to the House of Blues and eat on the patio and just people watch (costumes!!) Back to the hotel - they have a really nice work out room, free laundry service which are both bonuses! The bed was very comfortable and I didn't find myself saying I miss my own bed which I usually say at most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very practical, comfortable, and deluxe”
Reviews.Author: montagnard
Reviews.Content: Frequent, fast public bus, #992, fares single trip $2.50reg /$1.10 senior, from airport to 1/2 block away. Dozens of restaurants/bars and large Ralph's grocery close by. Kitchenette fully supplied. Free laundry in basement. Exercise equipment has own individual cable TV monitor/iPOD connect. Unusual to find a well-maintained sauna and steam room for relaxing. Studio is spacious and bed is huge and so comfortable. Excellent, frequent public transportation, $5 day pass, argues against car rental, even to nearby towns, except for rural trips, such as to Prince of Peace Abbey in Oceanside, which even that could be walked a bit. Wyndham service personnel always around+extremely helpful. Don't contribute to the "street" people. Social programs are available to them; donate instead to local churches'+charities' programs to help them. There are bike/foot patrols to avoid any unpleasantness.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and close to just about everything...”
Reviews.Author: travelertoo2
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Harbor Light is a great place to stay. The downside is the street noise especially on Friday and Saturday nights. But I am old. The room itself was very nicely done. The bed was very comfortable. The unit was quite clean always a big plus. The bath was roomy and there were grab bars in the shower another big plus. The widescreen TV was HD and the picture was very good. There wasn’t much of a view unless you like rooftops and street people. The location is a plus. It is in the Gaslamp District and near just about anything, the convention center, public transit, there are restaurants all around and you can walk to the ball park. Another plus? Starbucks is a block and a half away. The staff was terrific. The front desk was more than helpful and the valet guys were a hoot. On check-in I specifically told the clerk that I wanted no contact with “member services” (a euphemism for sales) and from actual sales we are already owners and had a stay at another Wyndham facility ruined by some pushy jerk. To our complete delight that request was honored and there were no phone calls or any other “offers”. Thank you. We had a problem with a leaky toilet and their guy made two attempts to fix it to no avail. The leak was small and did not interfere very much with our stay. All in all this is a great place to stay. We are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bzzybee13
Reviews.Content: We booked this on a timeshare exchange last minute and were very pleased. They fit a king bed, sofa, desk & chair, kitchen table w/ 2 chairs AND a kitchenette in one room and it still felt spacious. The bathroom was also big and beautiful. Everything in the room was clean and modern. The room had a balcony but it was very narrow, okay to stand on but no room for chairs. For our view, we had the NBC building in the distance, and a screaming cursing homeless man on the street below. It seemed this was "his spot" as he was there every day, so be warned - you can hear him through the closed door. I didn't let it bother me, just popped in some ear plugs. The location was great for getting around San Diego, just a couple of blocks from a trolley stop, and lots of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Also walking distance from the mall/movie theater. We liked the fact that there was a 24 hour doorman and valet - I think the parking was free but don't quote me... Overall a great place to stay in an awesome city :)

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE and we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mar12321
Reviews.Content: Harbour city lights is in a great location if you like the bar and restaurant scene. Probably a hundred bars and restaurants in a 6 block area. The staff at the hotel are excellent. The rooms are large and comfortable. Since this is a time share we were asked upon completing registration when we arrived (copied my credit card and checked ID) to go to a seperate area for the "second part of our registration" which I interpeted meant "try to sell you a time share and find out as much as possible about you." We declined after the long trip and were never bothered again. Everything you need is in the room to include a small kitchen and related items. One night we couldn't find a cork screw so we called the front desk and within 5 minutes one was brought to us. Nice small gym/sauna/steamroom in the basement. No pool. Parking $29.00 for 24 hours valet. Cheaper places to park in the area. There is a grocery store within walking distance which has a large deli and assorted wine, liquor, beer. Ralphs grocery store is the name and is down 5th avenue to g-street and then take a right for about four blocks. When I say down I mean down hill and when I say up I mean uphill. Once you arrive you will understand. From the airport take the city bus 901. Get off at 5th avenue walk half 200 feet to the hotel. Cost is $2.50 each for those under 60, Those over $1.10 each. Exact change required. Just stick it in the machine which excepts paper money and coin but gives NO change. One person can pay for two so generally I just put in 2.25 for the two of us. For a day pass for two I stuck in a $10.00 bill and got two day passess. We saw a lot of people everyday using the buses with backpacks and carry-ons. No big deal. A taxi ride is about $20.00 from the airport. Taxis are expensive everywhere else. The city buses and trolleys are safe and clean. The drivers, for the most part, are helpful and courteous. We did have a couple who were rude or just grouches when we asked if the bus went to a particular place. For any age a daily pass is $5.00 each day which allows for as many rides on the buses and trolleys as you want. Just show the pass when you board. We used the bus and trolleys to old town and the zoo as well the Midway Museum. One day we rented a car and went to Safari Park and the botantic gardens in Endicino which is about 50 miles. Covered both places in one day. Both are worth the trip. It takes a day or two to get the bus routes figured out. The city has a bus and trolley "trip planner" online and the hotel has free wifi so we used that. We recommend you take the buses or trolleys as parking is limited, costly, and traffic a pain and often oneway. WIFI is free in your room, just call the fornt desk for a password. Business center available but there is a charge. Now the bad. Noise on the weekends woke us several times. Mainly the extremely loud public safety sirens that seemed to echo.. We had a room fronting 5th avenue. The room doors are heavy so you can tell they tried to lesson the noise but if you are a light sleeper try to get an inside room away from 5th avenue or be prepared to wake several times each night. The homeless were everywhere holding cups, signs, and sleeping in doorways. They never bothered us but the sight and their condition was a bummer. In the park and trail along the harbour which is a favorite jogging/walking spot they take up a lot of space. We walked up to 5th avenue and then down to the harbour each morning (one half mile) . They have a great walking/biking/jogging trail that goes along the harbour for miles. Lots of nice restaurants as well. Don't miss Seaport village or the MIdway aircraft carrier (Museum). Balboa Park is next to the zoo and there are several museums and gardens where a lot of locals hang out on weekends having picnics and such. Very nice. We found prices are about 10% to 15% higher in San Diego than in Orlando Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown location, very comforable bed, noisy outside at night”
Reviews.Author: TheOneWhoLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: The location is right in the downtown, very convenient to all shops and restaurants, but evening music is heard till 2 am. Parking is a bit expensive at $29; although it is efficient. The building is new and well-maintained. There is no restaurant or pool on premises. There is a fitness center, sauna, and steam room downstairs. The rooms are very nice, spacious, have soft beds, duvets, and kitchen. We had a balcony, other rooms have larger windows instead. As a time-share place, they offered us to meet to discuss it rather in non-pushing way. We declined and they did not bother us again - pleasant surprise. The hotel has free internet of very good speed and free DVDs, books, and magazines for rent. I certainly recommend it as long as you are ok with mid-night noise.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for the Gaslamp Quarter and Public Transportation for everywhere else in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Ophelia693
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Harbour Lights was a great location for our tourist stay in San Diego. We were within walking distance of all the great restaurants in the GasLamp Quarter, as well as shopping and Seaport Village. The location is also perfect for picking up the great public transportation that San Diego has to offer to get to all the different interesting parts of the city. We stayed in a studio and it was quite large for a hotel room in the Quarter. A very clean and well decorated room with a comfy bed and pullout couch (also a comfy bed)! The little kitchen was perfect for our needs and well stocked with the supplies we needed for the week. All the staff were very friendly and accommodating, willing to help with whatever necessary. If you are looking for a good downtown location, with access to public transportation then this is a perfect place to stay. If you have your own car, you will have to pay $29 a night for the valet to put it in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: beanobob
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Harbour Lights is in the Gaslmap (downtown) district. We had a studio, and for the three of us was comfortable (however the kitchenette was small). We heard no noise from the street. Importantly, the staff was excellent. They were all pleasant, and extremely helpful. We were at the front desk constantly asking questions and they were more than willing to help with directions, information, advice. I believe they have the best customer service. They do have a fitness room/steam bath and sauna. The only negative I would say is they don't have a pool or a restaurant or a small gift shop, however, there are dozens and dozens of restaurants within a three block radius as well as a 7-1-1 and CVS a block away. And a Macy's and downtown shopping area are two blocks away. They are also very clost to the trolley, Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kimthailand
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in San Diego and I had a wonderful time! Harbor lights was more than I asked for :) I have stayed in 3 other Wyndham properties and this was by far the best and most updated one. Large comfy bed, convinant kitchenette and we were lucky enough to have a mini balcony facing 5th street views. We had a great time! The staff are very nice and helpful and the exercise room was perfect as well!!! By far the best property I have stayed in. Some eating suggestions: We got the best salmon and steak ever from Lou and mickeys down by the water ...it is pricey but worth every penny! We also did the sights and sips sunset cruise with hornblower and that was great as well...again pricey, but great sights and we met some really fun people along the way. San Diego is my new favorite place!!!! The only suggestion I would have for this property is that there wasn't much space to unpack our clothes, luckily my boyfriend didn't care so I got to use all the closet space, but had he cared it would have been tough! Definitly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lovely room - fantastic staff to help you!”
Reviews.Author: pat1Pdx
Reviews.Content: We (husband and wife) had a great stay over Memorial Day weekend. Yes - the street is loud - but when you close the windows - it was plenty quiet. We stopped by to drop our bags at 10 am and were told our room was ready - so we could check in. Perfect! The staff is all VERY helpful - we were waiting for a tour pick-up - and a man was trying to leave his luggage - turns out he was at the wrong hotel - so the bellman walked his luggage over to the correct place - that was a nice gesture. There are so many places to eat and walk around. There is a Ralph's grocery a few blocks away - and 7-11 for the quick milk/juice. Enjoy your stay here - we will be back again! (I could do without the pedicab folks hawking at you at the waterfront!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but noisy on St. Patrick's Day!”
Reviews.Author: calvesl
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family over Spring Break to San Diego. We stayed in this hotel, and overall, it was really great. The staff was very helpful. The front desk provided all the laundry detergent, dish soap, sheets, towels, etc. that we needed. They also helped us book a harbor cruise (DON'T use the Hornblower!) and gave us coupons for the zoo. They only asked once if we wanted to hear the timeshare presentation. The only complaint I have is that we stayed on St. Patrick's Day. It was incredibly loud because a stage was set up literally right outside of our window. The music stopped at 12:00 A.M. The front desk did offer us ear plugs. There's not really anything else they can do. Just be prepared for it if you go during this time of year. The location was perfect and the surrounding gas lamp quarter was really interesting. We did not have to deal with parking, but $29 a day seems steep. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. If you have a small child that needs a crib, they have them. It can be difficult if your child goes to bed early, but we managed.

Reviews.Title: “great time, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: tkt9280
Reviews.Content: i want to just say if you are planning a trip for 2, this is a great place to stay, staff is very knowlegeable about activities, the whole city is fun and friendly, rooms are excellent and mostly all new... great bed remind me of the westin.... no need for parking just take public transportation, best time is not having to deal with any traffic or finding parking... ok.. well, i will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quaint get away spot”
Reviews.Author: Prayzur
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to San Diego for Valentines day. We stayed in a newly renovated suite. It was spacious, clean, attactive and relatively inexpensive. As it was part of a timeshare chain, we were unfortunalely solicited for a unit. Other than that service was good. Located close to bars, restaurants and otehr attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but service has gone down”
Reviews.Author: Pastright77
Reviews.Content: My family had a reunion lately at this resort which is part of my uncles timeshare. We stayed here last year without the rest of the family and it looks like they might have had a major turnover lately. The nice friendly staff I remeber was no longer there and in fact one of the front desk staff ruined our sons birthday. He would always smile and greet us and offered bottle water when we would head out but on the night of my sons birthday we were waiting by the elevator (he must of thought we already went upstairs since the elevator is not in the vision of the front desk) but while we were waiting for it just 5 minutes after telling my son happy birthday and making a big deal of it our whole family over hears him having a conversation with his coworkers about how itll be finally nice to get that our big gropu out of here and that he doubts my son is mine since he looks nothin like his mother of father. Luckily my son is only 7 and didn't quite understand the conversation however it was very insulting to us. Nice to your face then judgemental when the guest is not around i guess. Other than that my family was told ahead of time we would only have a studio for our family of 4 but suprisingly we were all more than comfortable. They have a pull out couch and full kitchen thats filled with the neccessary utensils. Overall our reunion was great but they might want to hire back the pretty girls they had at front desk, beautiful people do get beautiful scores and on this stay I give there staff a 5 for the ugly behavior when the guest are not around.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: matchsticklady88
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty - dirt on ceiling from the fan / filthy air filter and we had to request it to be changed. They gave us a room with a view of the parking lot and air conditioners on the roof and expected us to buy in to the time share. Kids ran through the parking lot banging on cars and alarms started going off in the middle of the night. The parking fee is $29 per night which is pricey. No bell hop, I had to unload our luggage. Cracked paint and chipping in the bathroom. When we sat through the sales pitch they had another person who appeared to be writing when in fact she was taking notes in regards to our conversation. Pics of all this attached.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: penners27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Harbour Lights hotel as a guest through my parents' timeshare. As other reviews say, it is a louder place than most. We stayed on an upper floor facing 5th street and found that the sliding glass doors to the very small balcony blocked out a majority of the noise. We only heard the occasionally police sirens and screaming drunk girl. The staff was very friendly and, as we've found at other Wyndham resorts, the facility was clean. The mandatory valet parking was very pricey but the car was always ready within a few minutes of us calling down for it. It was also nice being within walking distance of many places to eat and a few places to shop. (We definitely recommend Spanish tapas at Cafe Sevilla nearby!) Our 2 year old was too big for their crib and won't sleep in a bed but luckily we borrowed my cousin's pack-n-play and all was good.

Reviews.Title: “100 percent satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Buddy-Bear
Reviews.Content: After a very disappointing experience at another Wyndham resort we were not expecting the excellence we encountered here. Both my wife and I travel a lot for business as well as for leisure. We rarely give a hotel a five star rating - but this resort (a former boutique hotel in the middle of Downtown San Diego) deserves five stars for everything. The location is one of the best you can ask for: The Gaslamp district with all its restaurants, bars, and specialty shops starts right at your front door. Other reviewers complained about the noise this location causes. We cannot agree. The noise level we experienced during our three night stay was not different from any other downtown hotel in any city. Our room was not large, it was giant, with a wonderful (double paned) bay window right above Fifth Avenue. The decorating style is modern with a very elegant comfortable flair. Everything looks fresh, new and clean. We had a King Size Bed, a pull out sofa, a full kitchen with all necessary utensils and a bathroom more than average in size. A flat screen TV, DVD- and CD-Player added to the comfort of the unit. You should know that the hotel is a timeshare, also available for rent. Like in every timeshare weekly housekeeping is provided, but not daily. There is no self-parking. Valet parking, which is prompt and easy, costs $ 27 per day with unlimited in and outs. This compares favorably with the rates one would have to pay in downtown garages where they charge you for each in and out. Everybody who works here was friendly and helpful all the time - from the receptionists to the bellboy and the valet. Check-in was a breeze. My wife and I agree that in the future should we return to San Diego we would not even try another hotel. It seldom happens that we leave a hotel 100 percent satisfied, even when we like the place. This was one of the rare exceptions!

Reviews.Title: “NOT PERFECT BUT NICE”
Reviews.Author: groovieguy
Reviews.Content: This resort is really a converted hotel.. The hotel is in the so called ( trendy ) Gaslamp district it reminded me a little of the Rush Street area in Chicago with the bars & restaurants. But sadly, with many more HOMELESS people laying about on the sidewalks not too far off the hotel main entrance.. We didn't have a problem with any kind of noise that others talked about in the reviews. We were on the 3rd floor of the hotel on Thursday and only stayed one night. There is good transportation just ask.. The staff was great, they bent over backwards to serve your needs,The concierge, Matthew was friendly and very helpful with info, , and rent a car reservations..The elevators worked well and were never crowded... We went for graduation from USMC bootcamp, this hotel has no shuttle to the base and is much too far away to walk from the trolley.. We stayed only because it was in the same area as the Marine Corp and on the list of places for our timeshare... Wyndham has better offerings than this location. We LOVE Grand Dessert Resorts in Las Vegas..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: A Couple of Traveling Seniors
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wyndham @Harbor Lights from 9/24/07-9/28/07. We enjoyed our stay very much. It was a nice change after camping in the N California parks and down the coast for 9 days. This is another stop on our 2007 Western Trip. See our earlier reviews. We had lots of adventures and breathtaking sights, and now we were ready for civilization. Harbor lights is located at the edge of the Gas Light District with trendy shops, restaurants, good transit system, 2 blocks from Horton Plaza Mall, etc. Lots of activity, energy & vitality. Great fun! This resort is really a converted hotel, as noted in the Wyndham info packet. The unit was a large, nicely decorated, comfortable studio. It had a nice, large bathroom, small, but well stocked galley kitchen near the entry, queen bed, sofa w/pullout bed, armoire for storage & TV/DVD, a nice desk for our computer (download pictures), and a small table & chairs in front of the window. The large window (no balcony) faced the side street, but we did not hear the noise that others have complained about - maybe because we were on an upper floor facing away from the main street. There was no washer/dryer (unusual for Wyndham resorts), and no WIFI in the unit. However, there was a good WIFI signal in the lobby with plenty of seating & tables so we could catch up on email. The nicely equipped laundry, with large machines and tables, was in the basement near several resort offices. It was secure and comfortable. The elevators worked well and were never crowded. Parking was by the valet in a garage somewhere nearby. We did not see our vehicle for 4 days. This is not unusual for urban resorts and is noted in Wyndham info. We felt that the parking fee ($25/day) & tips was worth every penny. Public transportation is a part of the urban experience. The staff at Harbor Lights was great. The doorman was friendly and lots of fun to talk too. The check-in/check-out were both fast & smooth. The concierge was friendly and very helpful with info, discount tickets, reservations, etc. The "owner's update " (points sales pitch) was not bad at all - actually fast (<1hour) and friendly, after we told him that we had all of the points that we need. We had no problems with the unit, so I cannot address the maintenance staff - everything worked perfectly. We did not need maid service (we can pick up after ourselves) - but our unit was spotless when we arrived. Really, another "home away from home". We did not spend much time in the unit - we were enjoying San Diego. The bus stop & trolley stop nearby were a convenient way to see the city. We spent 2 days (not enough time) at Balboa Park and the Zoo. We took a Trolley tour of the city and of course enjoyed the wonderful restaurants and shops in the Gas Light District. We enjoyed wonderful dinners at Asti Restaurantie(1 block), Dakota Grille(next door), and Top of the Market @ Fish Market (at the harbor). This is a nice place, not exactly like most Wyndham Resorts (condos), but really a great urban property in a lively, colorful, interesting city. We enjoyed our stay and would love to return some day. Friday, we headed east, toward San Antonio, TX, through National Parks in CA, AZ, & NM and TX. See our next review.

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT SPOT FOR EVERYTHING SAN DIEGO WE'RE GOING BACK IN MAY”
Reviews.Author: 2twotravel
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego to see our Son RJ, we were not sure where to stay and he suggested the Gaslamp area. We chose Harbour Lights and were not disapointed. The staff was great, they bent over backwards to serve your needs, The room was beautiful and well set up and the location was perfect. We loved being in the mix og things in the gaslamp district. Bars and restaurants galore no matter what your taste. The mall was 1/2 block away. We took the trolly tour, WOW was that worth $35. It took you everywhere from the water front to the Zoo,Old Town and every place in between. A great way to see San Diego without a car. Now we know why our son loves San Diego. By the way he is a chef at the Southpark Bar and Grill on Fern st. A great place for good food and jazz.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaneyBella
Reviews.Content: We booked this through my parent's timeshare. Let me start by saying the facility is very nice and the employees were very friendly and helpful. However, I wish we would have read the previous reviews before we made plans to stay here. We had our toddler and preschooler with us and keeping them entertained while we were there was a challenge. I would not describe it as "kid friendly". It's a great location for couples who like dining and bars, or even a baseball game, however. There is no place for kids to go to play. Even the main lobby isn't really a lobby. The "lobby area" consisted of tables filled with sales people and prospective timeshare clients. It almost felt as if we were walking through a new car showroom. They would be better served if the sales personnel handled that business out of sight of the lobby. There was no room for guests to hang out. As a matter of fact, they were constantly giving tours, so the elevator was always jammed. When we went to check out, not only was everyone else checking out, we had to compete with the salespeople giving tours. We couldn't get an elevator! They need to take care of current clients and not give priority to prospective ones. No pool, no lobby, no park nearby for the kids; a broken crib, a TON of noise every night of the week and homeless people hanging out right outside of the building. Go there on a couples getaway, but leave your kids at home.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual experience.”
Reviews.Author: mgarcia91701
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through our timeshare. It is a great location for someone in San Diego on business, or even for a romantic weekend. However, my wife and I went with our daughter to see the sights in San Diego, and the hotel was not someplace I would ever stay again. To start, if you want to park at the hotel, it is twenty five dollars a day. The hotel advertises that you can come and go as often as possible, however if you do so, it is only customary to tip the valet. So, the more you come in and out, the more it costs you. Some of the valets were fantastic, very friendly, and overall extremely helpful. The room was clean, but slightly dated. We were told that the rooms will soon be renovated, but they were not bad. The hotel does not have a pool, and swimming in the Pacific Ocean in October is not something I would recommend for anyone, it is far to cold. The hotel is located in the middle of Gas Lamp, which for the right people this would be great. Again, with my family, it was not a great location at all. The noise level was extremely high in our room from the surrounding bars etc. We checked out four days early due to how loud it was at night, and we were actually on the fourth floor. I can't imagine how bad it was for people in the lower floors. In comparison to other hotels we have stayed at through our timeshare, this hotel left us extremely unhappy. We absolutely do not recommend this hotel to anyone who might be taking a child or children.

Reviews.Title: “Gas Lamp Living”
Reviews.Author: tdogdo
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Harbor Lights is in the trendy Gaslamp District of downtown San Diego. We were in San Diego for a convention, and the hotel was a short 10 minute walk away from the Convention Center. There are dozens of restaurants, shops and bars down 5th Ave. It's lively and loud all night long on the weekends. The hotel itself was basic. It felt like a downtown apartment. All the rooms are studios with a kitchenette (fridge, 2 burner stovetop, microwave, sink and dishwasher). The room was definitely functional and comfortable. It's a bit outdated, but we were told they are planning a huge renovation. Parking is Valet only and $25/day. There is no nearby public parking, so it's a necessary expense. The one thing it lacked was a pool. We would've loved to sit down and relax on a sunny afternoon. Still, you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kmiddleton
Reviews.Content: I loved the location. This hotel is located in the perfect place. It is one block from the mall and close to countless places to eat, party, and shop. It is located one block from the trolley service and directly on the bus line. This hotel is the perfect location for someone that has never been to San Diego...everything is right at your fingertips. The hotel is now owned by Wydham and available for timeshare parcipants. The staff was helpul and friendly. The only down side is that they want to sell you more ownership during your visit. Just say "no" if you are not interested. Do not fall for the "free gift" bribes if you are not interested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: homantag
Reviews.Content: We are Wyndham timeshare owners, and booked this location for a weekend getaway from Los Angeles. The location is basically in the heart of the Gas Lamp area of Downtown San Diego. If you want a quiet place, this is not somewhere you should stay. If you want to be in the midst of the San Diego action however, this location is prime. All the rooms are studios, except for one (which is a 1BD). The studios are fine. Everything seems to be newer. There are not many amenities on-site (i.e., pool, etc.), however, you are close to everything like the beach, etc. The rooms are decent size, bigger than most hotel rooms, and average appointments. Each has a kitchenette, so there is a 2-burner stove, microwave, dishwasher, coffee machine, blender, pots, pans, utensils, etc. We had a unit in the back corner (609), and I think we are happy it was there. Being on the main "strip" of the Gas Lamp, having a room in the front of the building would be way too loud (most especially during the weekend). Not much as far as views at this location. The whole building is 7 floors, so not a highrise either. All in all, very good and comfortable stay. No parking on-site, you have to valet at $25 per day (but it includes in-and-out privileges, so it is worth it in that regard (otherwise, for surface lots you have to pay each time, and there weren't any close by). Only reason I don't rate this place as "excellent" is because it is not like a 5-star resort or anything - but I am picky that way.

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Harbour Lights
HotelInfo.Address: 911 5th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly Fairfield)
